subject_terms_3: Geographical areas and countries Trade and industry
physical_appearance: This is a map of Southeast Asia in the mid 17th century and its title can be found at the top. It is a colourful illustration, charts the numerous oceans of the region, has three cartouches, one coat of arms, and several sailing vessels
sgcool_label_text: Henricus Hondius's 1636 map of Southeast Asia was based on Willem Blaeu's map from the previous year. Both maps were vast improvements from earlier maps of the region, and present the extent of the trading influence of the Dutch East India Company. This map features a dedication in Latin to the wealthy Dutch merchant Christophoro Thisio.
